questions.Question: Which of the following governments recently launched a free household power connection scheme called 'Prakash hai to Vikash hai' for the poor in the state to mark former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birthday?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Uttar Pradesh government has recently launched a free household power connection scheme 'Prakash hai to vikas hai' for the poor in the state to mark former prime minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee's birthday. Initially, the two village Lohban and Gausana of Mathura district have been covered for 100% electrification. Under this scheme, the state government has a target of covering 16 million by the end of 2018. Apart from this, the UP government has also introduced Kisan Uday Yojana, scheme for farmers in which existing 5 HP/7.5 HP submersible and coupling sets of farmers will be replaced free of cost. questions.Question: Who headed the committee on 'computerisation' in Indian Banks(1988)?
questions.solution: Solution:		The first blueprint for computerization in the Banking Industry was drawn up in 1983-84. A Committee was set up in 1983 under the chairmanship of Dr. C. Rangarajan, the then Deputy Governor, Reserve Bank of India, to look into the modalities of drawing a phased plan of mechanization in the Banking Industry, covering the period 1985-89. The Committee submitted its report in 1984 and recommended the introduction of computerization at Branch, Regional, and Head Office levels of banks. The banking industry has since come a long way in computerizing their front and back-office operations as per the guidelines of Rangarajan Committee. Against this background and the experience gained in the eighties, RBI set up in September 1988, another Committee, again the chairmanship of Dr. C. Rangarajan, Deputy Governer, to draw up a perspective plan of computerization for the banking industry for the five year’s period 1990-94 and also to consider other allied issues.Source :inflibnet.ac.in

questions.solution: Solution:		Julia Eileen Gillard (born 29 September 1961) is an Australian politician who served as the 27th Prime Minister of Australia and Leader of the Labor Party from 2010 to 2013, the first and only woman to date to hold either role.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the President of Republic of the Union of Myanmar?
questions.solution: Solution:		On 15 March 2016, the Assembly of the Union elected Htin Kyaw as the 9th president of Myanmar.

questions.Question: Sunita Williams is a
questions.solution: Solution:		Sunita Lyn Williams is an American astronaut and United States Navy officer of Indian origin who formerly held the records for most spacewalks by a woman (seven) and most spacewalk time for a woman (50 hours, 40 minutes).

questions.Question: Name the American film cartoonist who created Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck.
questions.solution: Solution:		Walt Disney (1901 - 1966), the co-creator of Mickey Mouse and founder of The Walt Disney Company, was the original voice of Mickey.

questions.Question: As many as 6,117 Kuchipudi dancers set a new Guiness World Record by performing together in a single event at
questions.solution: Solution:		6,117 Kuchipudi dancers set a new Guinness World Record by performing together in a single event at the Vijayawada district of Andhra Pradesh.

questions.Question: On 22nd March, 2018 who unveiled the book, Neel Ke Dhabbe on the occasion of 106th Bihar Day in Patna?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bihar has celebrated its 106th foundation day on 22 March, 2018. A number of programmes have been organized throughout the state on the occasion. Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu inaugurated a 3-day Bihar Diwas celebrations in Patna and also released 4 books- 'Ek Tha Mohan', 'Bapu Ki Chiththi', 'Champaran Ki Kahani' and 'Neel Ke Dhabbe' on this occasion. The 2018 theme for this year's celebrations is "Centenary of Champaran Satyagraha and Elimination of Dowry and Child Marriage". It was on this day when the British carved out the state from Bengal Presidency in 1912. Before that Bengal, Bihar, Jharkhand and Orissa were part of the Bengal province during the British rule.

questions.Question: Who has inaugurated the first-ever Persons of Indian Origin (PIO) Parliamentary Conference in Delhi?
questions.solution: Solution:		Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated the first-ever Persons of Indian Origin (PIO) Parliamentary Conference in the Pravasi Bharatiya Kendra (PBK) in Delhi on 9 January, 2018. Approx 124 Members of Parliament (MP) and 17 mayors from 23 countries will participate in this conference. The conference is a way of reaching out to the Indian community overseas by the Central government. The event will have two thematic sessions, the first one will have as special guest senior Congress leader and chairman of the parliamentary committee on external affairs, Shashi Tharoor. The session will be presided over by Deputy Chairman of the Rajya Sabha. The second session will have Parliamentary Affairs minister Ananth Kumar as a special guest which will be chaired by Deputy Speaker of the Lok Sabha.

questions.Question: Andrez Manuel Lopez Obrador is President elected in July 2018 of which of the following country?
questions.solution: Solution:		Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador also known by his initials AMLO, is a Mexican politician serving as the current president of Mexico since 1 December 2018.

questions.Question: Who is Kapil Sibal?
questions.optionD: Economic Advisor to Prime Minister of India
questions.solution: Solution:		Kapil Sibal is Telecom Minister of India.

questions.Question: Who is the MD and CEO of Allahabad Bank as of March 2018?
questions.solution: Solution:		Usha Ananthasubramaniam is the MD and CEO of Allahabad Bank as of March 2018.

questions.Question: Dr. Urjit Patel, who has been appointed recently as Governor of Reserve Bank of India, was holding which position immediately prior to this appointment?
questions.solution: Solution:		Dr. Urjit Patel was Deputy Governor of RBI before becoming Governor of Reserve Bank of India.

questions.Question: Who among the following was elected as President of the Sahitya Akademi in 2018?
questions.solution: Solution:		On February 12th, 2018, famous Kannada litterateur Chandrasekhar Kambar was elected the new president of Sahitya Akademi.

questions.Question: Who became first female president of Singapore?
questions.solution: Solution:		Halimah Binti Yacob (born 23 August 1954) is a Singaporean politician. She is the incumbent President of Singapore after being elected in an uncontested election in the 2017 Singapore presidential election. She is the first female president in the country's history.

questions.Question: Which one among the following statements regarding Rabindranath Tagore's concern for the natural world and environment is not correct?
questions.optionA: Caring for nature on aesthetic grounds, as Tagore did, has now become one of the major environmental concerns in the developed countries of the world.
questions.optionB: Tagore's short stories and novels exhibit his concern for nature.
questions.optionC: Tagore's vision of education emphasized the need to generate environmental awareness among the students.
questions.optionD: Tagore's concern about the environment was activated by pragmatic and utilitarian considerations.
questions.solution: Solution:		Tagore's vision of education emphasized the need to generate environmental awareness among the students is an incorrect statement.

questions.Question: Who among the following is the Chairman of the Fourteenth Finance Commission?
questions.solution: Solution:		Y. V. Reddy is the Chairman of the Fourteenth Finance Commission.

questions.Question: Who was awarded best actress award in the 64th National Film awards function?
questions.solution: Solution:		Surabhi C. M., also known as Surabhi Lakshmi is an Indian film, television, and stage actress who appears in Malayalam films and television. She won the National Film Award for Best Actress in 2016 for portraying the role of a struggling middle-aged mother in the Malayalam film Minnaminungu.

questions.Question: Who amongst the following has taken over as the President of Serbia after General elections held there in February 2008?
questions.solution: Solution:		Incumbent President Boris Tadic was re-elected as President of Serbia in the second round with 51.61 percent of the votes cast, defeating challenger Tomislav Nikolic.

questions.Question: As of August 2018, who is the Chief Minister of Sikkim?
questions.solution: Solution:		As of August 2018, Pawan Kumar Chamling is the Chief Minister of Sikkim.

questions.Question:
Consider the following statements about Ustad Ali Akbar Khan, who died in June, 2009:
1. He was a Sarod Maestro.
2. He belonged to the Maihar Gharana of classical hindustani music.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ali Akbar Khan (14 April 1922 - 18 June 2009) was an Indian Hindustani classical musician of the Maihar gharana, known for his virtuosity in playing the sarod.

questions.Question:

1. He was the first President of South Africa.
2. Mandela spent 18 years in prison on Robben Island.
3. Mandela became the President in 1990 after his release from the prison.
questions.solution: Solution:		Mandela spent the first 18 of his 27 years in jail at the brutal Robben Island Prison.

questions.Question: Mr. Arjun Munda was on September 11, 2010 sworn in as the Chief Minister of Jharkhand. How many MLAs in the 81-member Assembly supported him?
questions.solution: Solution:		Arjun Munda has the support of 45 MLAs in the 81-member Assembly.

questions.Question: Who is Arunima Sinha?
questions.optionB: First Indian business woman to reach a billion dollar
questions.optionC: First Indian physically challenged lady to scale Everest
questions.solution: Solution:		Arunima Sinha is an Indian mountain climber and sportswoman. She is a mountaineer the World's first female amputee to scale Mount Everest, Mount Kilimanjaro, Mount Elbrus, Mount Kosciusko, Mount Aconcagua, Carstensz Pyramid and Mount Vinson, she is also seven time Indian volleyball player.

questions.Question: V. R. Krishna Iyer, who passed away in December 2014 was a/an
questions.solution: Solution:		Justice Vaidyanathapuram Rama Iyer Krishna Iyer was an Indian judge who became a pioneer of judicial activism.

questions.Question: Who among the following Urdu poets was invited to the Second and Third Round Table Conference?
questions.solution: Solution:		Sir Muhammad Iqbal, widely known as Allama Iqbal, was a poet, philosopher and politician, as well as an academic, barrister and scholar in British India who is widely regarded as having inspired the Pakistan Movement. He is called the "Spiritual Father of Pakistan." He was invited to the Second and Third round table conference.

questions.Question: The recently appointed Chief of the Nepal Army (August - September 2009) belongs to?
questions.solution: Solution:		The appointed Chief of the Nepal Army (August - September 2009) belongs to Indigenous tribes.

questions.Question: Chandi Prasad Bhatt is a well known :
questions.solution: Solution:		Chandi Prasad Bhatt (born 1934) is an Indian Gandhian environmentalist and social activist, who founded Dasholi Gram Swarajya Sangh (DGSS) in Gopeshwar in 1964, which later became a mother-organization to the Chipko Movement.

questions.Question: The name of Pierre Cardin is associated with which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pierre Cardin is a French fashion designer.

questions.Question: Who is well known collector of artefacts and curios?
questions.solution: Solution:		The Salar Jung family was a noble Hyderabad family under the Nizams, who ruled from 1720 to 1948. They are credited with safeguarding rare artifacts and collections, which are now at Salar Jung Museum.

questions.Question: Ms. Vijaya Mehta has earned distinction in which of the field?
questions.solution: Solution:		Vijaya Mehta is a noted Indian Marathi film and theatre director and also an actor in many films from the Parallel Cinema. She is a founder member of Mumbai-based theatre group, Rangayan with playwright Vijay Tendulkar, and actors Arvind Deshpande and Shriram Lagoo.

questions.Question: Dr. M. S. Swaminathan has distinguished himself in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mankombu Sambasivan Swaminathan is an Indian geneticist and administrator, known for his role in India's Green Revolution. Swaminathan has been called the "Father of Green Revolution in India" for his role in introducing and further developing high-yielding varieties of wheat in India.

questions.Question: Satyen Bose has shown his excellence in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		 Satyen Bose (22 January 1916 - 9 June 1993) was a film director from India. He has directed both Bengali and Hindi films. Among his most notable films are: Raat Aur Din, Chalti Ka Naam Gaadi, Dosti and Jagriti. Jagriti won the Filmfare Best Movie Award in 1956 and Dosti won same award in 1964.

questions.Question: Who had taken over charge as the IGP of Kashmir Range?

questions.Question: Who was elected as the new Chief Minister in Meghalaya after the assembly election in 2013?
questions.solution: Solution:		Mukul Manda Sangma was sworn-in as the Meghalaya chief minister in 2013.

questions.Question: Guru Gopi Krishna was a maestro of which of the following dance format?
questions.solution: Solution:		Gopi Krishna was an exponent of the Benares Gharana style of Kathak. He incorporated many elements of Kathakali and Bharatnatyam in his dance.

questions.Question: Ms. Bachendri Pal had undertaken a unique expedition for focusing attention on which of these?
questions.solution: Solution:		Bachendri Pal is an Indian mountaineer, who in 1984 became the first Indian woman to reach the summit of Mount Everest. She was awarded the third highest civilian award Padma Bhushan by Government of India in 2019.

questions.Question: Which of the following fields A. Nageshwara Rao is associated with?
questions.solution: Solution:		Akkineni Nageswara Rao, widely known as ANR, was an Indian film actor and producer, known for his works predominantly in Telugu cinema.

questions.Question: Jamini Roy was a famous?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jamini Roy (11 April 1887 - 24 April 1972) was an Indian painter. He was honoured with the State award of Padma Bhushan in 1955. He was one of the most famous pupils of Abanindranath Tagore, whose artistic originality and contribution to the emergence of art in India remains unquestionable.

questions.Question: In which field 'Achchan Maharaj' has distinguished himself?
questions.solution: Solution:		Achchan Maharaj was a court dancer of several states of North India, and served for a long time at Raigarh.

questions.Question: Who fits with this description 'Indian Cotton merchant, Banker, Congressman, a close associate of Mahatma Gandhi'?
questions.solution: Solution:		Jamnalal Bajaj was an Indian industrialist, a merchant, a philanthropist, and Indian independence fighter. He founded the Bajaj Group of companies in the 1920s, and the group now has 24 companies, including six that are listed on the bourses. He was also a close and beloved associate of Mahatma Gandhi, who is known to have often declared that Jamnalal was his fifth son.

questions.Question: Pandit Jasraj has established his reputation in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		Pandit Jasraj (28 January 1930 - 17 August 2020) was an Indian classical vocalist, belonging to the Mewati gharana (musical apprenticeship lineage). His musical career spanned 75 years resulting in national and international fame, respect and numerous major awards and accolades. His legacy includes memorable performances of classical and semi-classical vocal music, classical and devotional music, albums and film soundtracks, innovations in various genres including Haveli Sangeeth and popularizing the Mewati Gharana - a school of thought in Hindustani classical music.

questions.Question: Ustad Nisar Hussain Khan earned distinction in which of the following fields?
questions.solution: Solution:		Ustad Nissar Hussain Khan (1909 - 93) was an Indian classical vocalist from the Rampur-Sahaswan gharana. He was a disciple and son of Fida Hussain Khan and after a long and illustrious career was awarded the Padma Bhushan in 1971.

questions.Question: R. K. Laxman is a renowned -
questions.solution: Solution:		Rasipuram Krishnaswami Laxman(24 October 1921 - 26 January 2015), commonly known as R. K. Laxman, was an Indian cartoonist, illustrator, and humorist.

questions.Question: Dr. Amiya Chakravarthy is known for his -
questions.optionC: being literary Secretary to R. N. Tagore
questions.solution: Solution:		Amiya Chandra Chakravarty (1901- 1986) was an Indian literary critic, academic, and Bengali poet. He was a close associate of Rabindranath Tagore, and edited several books of his poetry. He was also an associate of Gandhi, and an expert on the American catholic writer and monk, Thomas Merton.
